intro: Galinsogeopsis spilanthoides var. spilanthoides, commonly known as the spilanthoides variant of Galinsogeopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
